title: Zero Day Summer: Microsoft Warns of Fresh New Software Exploits
description:
Microsoft’s struggles with zero-day exploits rolled into a new month with a fresh Patch Tuesday warning about malware attacks in the wild.

The post Zero Day Summer: Microsoft Warns of Fresh New Software Exploits appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Intel Capital Bets on Zenity for Low-Code/No-Code Security
description:
Israeli security startup Zenity banks $16.5 million in new venture capital funding to work on ‘low-code/no-code’ security technology.

The post Intel Capital Bets on Zenity for Low-Code/No-Code Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Adobe Says Critical PDF Reader Zero-Day Being Exploited
description:
Adobe raises an alarm for new in-the-wild zero-day attacks hitting users of its widely deployed Adobe Acrobat and Reader product.

The post Adobe Says Critical PDF Reader Zero-Day Being Exploited  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Thousands of Code Packages Vulnerable to Repojacking Attacks
description:
Despite GitHub’s efforts to prevent repository hijacking, researchers continue finding new attack methods, and thousands of code packages.

The post Thousands of Code Packages Vulnerable to Repojacking Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Vector Embeddings – Antidote to Psychotic LLMs and a Cure for Alert Fatigue?
description:
Vector embeddings – data stored in a vector database – can be used to minimize hallucinations from a GPT-style large language model AI system (such as ChatGPT) and perform automated triaging on anomaly alerts. 

The post Vector Embeddings – Antidote to Psychotic LLMs and a Cure for Alert Fatigue? appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Iranian Cyberspies Deployed New Backdoor to 34 Organizations
description:
Iran-linked cyberespionage group Charming Kitten has infected at least 34 victims in Brazil, Israel, and UAE with a new backdoor.

The post Iranian Cyberspies Deployed New Backdoor to 34 Organizations appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: ICS Patch Tuesday: Critical CodeMeter Vulnerability Impacts Several Siemens Products
description:
ICS Patch Tuesday: Siemens has released 7 new advisories and Schneider Electric has released 1 new advisory.

The post ICS Patch Tuesday: Critical CodeMeter Vulnerability Impacts Several Siemens Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: China-Linked ‘Redfly’ Group Targeted Power Grid
description:
Symantec warns that the Redfly APT appears to be focusing exclusively on targeting critical national infrastructure organizations.

The post China-Linked ‘Redfly’ Group Targeted Power Grid appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Finding Your Way in Cloud Security
description:
The next time you see CNAPP, CASB, WAAS, CSPM or many of the other phrases, it will be helpful to take a deep breath and realize enterprise security has never been a binary one or zero.

The post Finding Your Way in Cloud Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Cleafy Raises €10 Million for Online Banking Fraud Prevention Platform
description:
Real-time online banking fraud prevention firm Cleafy has raised €10 million ($10.7 million) in a funding round led by United Ventures.

The post Cleafy Raises €10 Million for Online Banking Fraud Prevention Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Court Convicts Portuguese Hacker in Football Leaks Trial and Gives Him a 4-Year Suspended Sentence
description:
Portuguese hacker behind “Football Leaks” convicted by a Lisbon court of nine crimes and given a suspended prison sentence of four years.

The post Court Convicts Portuguese Hacker in Football Leaks Trial and Gives Him a 4-Year Suspended Sentence appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: DFIR Company Binalyze Raises $19 Million in Series A Funding
description:
Estonian DFIR company Binalyze has raised $19 million in a Series A funding round to grow and improve its product. 

The post DFIR Company Binalyze Raises $19 Million in Series A Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Google Patches Chrome Zero-Day Reported by Apple, Spyware Hunters
description:
Google has released a Chrome 116 security update to patch CVE-2023-4863, the fourth Chrome zero-day vulnerability documented in 2023.

The post Google Patches Chrome Zero-Day Reported by Apple, Spyware Hunters appeared first on SecurityWeek.
